author: mklement0
body:
Steps to reproduce (macOS only)
------------------

```powershell
PSonMacOS> Get-Help nosuch
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

An error indicating that no help was found for the specified search term.

```none
Get-Help: Get-Help could not find nosuch in a help file in this session. 
...
```

Actual behavior
---------------

The error complains unexpectedly complains about a missing `[wmiclass]` type.

```none
Get-Help : Unable to find type [wmiclass].
...
```

Note that this problem does not occur on Windows or Linux.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.1.0-preview.3 on macOS 10.13.5
```

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hum! Interesting.  I'm getting a different result.
```
kronos:~ maxt$ pwsh-preview
PowerShell v6.1.0-preview.3
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /Users/maxt> get-help nosuchhelp
get-help : Get-Help could not find nosuchhelp in a help file in this session. To download updated help topics type: "Update-Help". To get help online, search for the help topic in the TechNet library at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=107116.                                                                                                              At line:1 char:1                                                                                                        + get-help nosuchhelp                                                                                                   + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                                                                                                   + CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [Get-Help], HelpNotFoundException                                    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : HelpNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetHelpCommand  


PS /Users/maxt> $PSVersionTable                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Name                           Value                                                                                    ----                           -----                                                                                    PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.3                                                                          
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.3
OS                             Darwin 17.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.6.0: Tue May  8 15:22:16 PDT 2018; root:xnu-45...
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0



PS /Users/maxt> sw_vers                                                                                                 ProductName:    Mac OS X                                                 
ProductVersion:	10.13.5
BuildVersion:	17F77
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Thanks, @MaximoTrinidad.

As I now realize, the problem is related to the code in my specific `$PROFILE` file - when I bypass it, the problem goes away.

Still, this error should never be reported. 

I'll try to narrow down what, specifically, makes the problem surface.

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: Closing this, because I found the true underlying problem - see #7234.

title: Get-Help reports spurious error when it can't find help on macOS
